summary: Build a fully responsive, mobile-first Birthday Website for "Gray" using Next.js 14 (App Router), Tailwind CSS, and Framer Motion, featuring a landing page with GIF carousel/poem/open-when navigation plus dynamic themed mood pages with an animated chat-style thread fed from static TypeScript mock data.
architectural_notes: Use static TypeScript mock data (data.ts) as the only data source; no backend/database.
Next.js 14+ App Router with dynamic route /mood/[slug] driven by mood section IDs/slugs from data.ts.
Use next/font/google for two fonts: clean sans-serif for body and cursive/handwritten for headings/poem.
Use Framer Motion for key interactions: GIF carousel cross-fade loop (AnimatePresence) and page/message transitions.
Mobile-first Tailwind approach: optimize for smallest screens first, then scale up.

existing_features.title: Create a frontend-only single-page app experience with client-side routing for: (1) a landing page at "/" and (2) dynamic mood pages at "/mood/:slug" (e.g., "/mood/sad").

Add a static TypeScript mock data module (e.g., frontend/src/data.ts) that exports MoodSection and Message types and a list of MoodSection records, structured so URLs/text can be swapped later without code changes.
Implement the landing page ("/") with a light, airy, celebratory design (soft pastels/whites/subtle gradients), strict mobile-first layout, and clean typography.
Add a landing-page hero section that displays a 3-GIF carousel for Gray with an infinite auto-play cross-fade transition (no hard cuts).
Add a poem section under the hero that uses a cursive/handwritten font for headings/poem text, centered and readable, with scroll-triggered reveal animation line-by-line or word-by-word.

Implement an “Open when” navigation grid on the landing page with 5 distinctive cards/buttons labeled exactly: (1) Open when you feel sad (2) Open when doubting yourself (3) Open when you want to laugh (4) Open when celebrating something big (5) Open when overwhelmed or stressed; each navigates to its corresponding /mood/:slug page and has satisfying hover/tap scale feedback.
Add landing-page footer actions with two distinct buttons: “Personal Playlist” and “Love Globe”, implemented as visual placeholders that only log a message to the console when clicked.
Implement dynamic mood pages at "/mood/:slug" that load the selected MoodSection from the static data module and apply mood-based theming (background gradient, accent colors, overall vibe) per mood.

Create a premium chat-thread UI on mood pages that mimics a high-end WhatsApp/iMessage thread: message bubbles render text/audio/video message types, sender avatars are small looping GIFs, and message alignment alternates (or uses a consistent timeline style).
Add motion/animation polish: (1) mood-page message list staggers in on initial load with fade + slide-up from bottom, and (2) add page transitions between routes that feel smooth and celebratory.

Add global typography setup with two Google fonts: a clean sans-serif for body text and a premium cursive/handwritten font for poem text and key headings; ensure consistent application across the app.

Landing page: Hero section with 3-GIF cross-fade auto-playing carousel using Framer Motion AnimatePresence
Landing page: Poem section using cursive font with scroll-triggered line-by-line/word-by-word reveal animation

Landing page: Footer actions for 'Personal Playlist' and 'Love Globe' as visual placeholders logging to console on click
Dynamic mood pages (/mood/[slug]) with mood-based theming (background/accents/gradients) driven by data
